TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TermCollection extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Generic.TaxonomyItemCollection`1<class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term>
Public NotInheritable Class TermCollection Inherits TaxonomyItemCollection(Of Term)

remarks.para: This class provides standard support for the interface and the interface and an integer indexer through the GenericCollection base class. In addition it provides a string indexer based on the default object of the object and a GUID indexer based on the property

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the next set of paged data in the collection.
Docs.returns: true if a new set of paged data is retrieved; false if no remaining paged data available

remarks.para: This method populates the collection with the next subset of paged data available. The maximum size of the subset is based on the paging limit that was specified when the collection was initially created or retrieved. The values is available in the property.If this collection is not paged then the property returns 0 and the method has no effect and returns false. In this case, the collection has already been retrieved in its entirety.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PagingLimit As Integer
public: property int PagingLimit { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of items that can be contained in the current collection.
Docs.value: The maximum number of items that can be contained in this collection if the collection is using data paging, or zero if the collection is not using data paging.

remarks.para: The method uses this property to determine the maximum number of items to get each time it is called. This property can only be set when the collection is initially created or get by explicitly setting a parameter in the method used to get the collection. Not all methods used to get collections support returning a paged collection.
If this collection is not paged then the property returns 0 and the method has no effect and returns false. In this case, the collection has already been retrieved in its entirety.
